page.title: 09TOURISM IN MALVERN WELLS ii
page.content: Tourism is the second largest local employer after radar research. The main physical attraction is walking on the{open common land}of the Hills, the focal point being the large car park at the foot of Herefordshire Beacon. This gives access to the{Iron Age Fort and the main ridges. Spectacular views east across the{Severn plain}to the {Cotswolds}and west to the{Welsh {Marchlands}were the inspiration for much of the music of Sir Edward Elgar - British Camp fort inspired the cantata{'Caractacus'.}The cultural attractions lie in Malvern's central location to the cathedral cities of {Worcester, Hereford and Gloucester. The yearly Malvern Festival emphasises the{music of Elgar}and the{plays of {Shaw.}A signposted 'Elgar Route' takes car drivers to{St.Wulstan's Church}at Little Malvern where Elgar was buried.
